pageContext.description: Rib and pellet ornamentation - one pellet on each face surrounded by circle. Edge sharp and showing signs of resharpening under the patina. Ornamentation rather faint - worn mould. This axe is fractured across one face, and then is a hole beside the loop - a casting fault.
pageContext.associations: Part of a (?) founder's hoard of 6, in an area rich in Bronze and Iron Age Sites.
pageContext.publications: Cumb. + West. A. T. A. Soc. Trans. (illus.) N.S. III, p. 410.,NS V, p. 183 (ils),Barrow Nats. Field Club Trans. XVII, p. 211.
pageContext.site: England,Lancashire (Furness),Urswick,Little Cow Close, Steelmore Heads,Found as part of a hoard of 6 socketed bronze axes, 13 June 1902, while quarrying limestone.
